item.title: Criteo predicts that half of all e-commerce in Asia will be conducted through mobile devices
item.description:
Criteo, a performance marketing technology company, reports in its Q4 2014 State of Mobile Commerce Report that mobile transactions now represent more than 30% of global e-commerce transactions. Source: Criteo. Jonathan Wolf, Chief Product Officer at Criteo, stated that a lack of information about mobile commerce has led many marketers to underestimate the potential of this market. Criteo’s State of Mobile Commerce Report leverages their extensive transaction-level data, encompassing billions of transactions, to provide a clearer picture of the global mobile commerce landscape...

item.title: Marco, it's Polo on Your Mobile
item.description:
Fashion giant Ralph Lauren is taking shopping to the next level by moving beyond online stores and embracing mobile shopping via cell phones. This shift, known as mobile or m-commerce, is poised to become as significant as e-commerce has been in recent times. Its success relies on internet-enabled smartphones and mobile-friendly websites designed for smaller screens, along with advancements like barcode scanning software and web-connected vending machines.
